page.title: 11Gadsbridge Farm.
page.content: This is an{arable farm}of 320 acres which is situated on the Forest Green Road. The present farmer has been farming this land for 18 years.{Wheat and{barley}are the main crops grown and some grass is also grown for{hay.} There are about 14 fields and most of them have special names, the oldest is called Spratts Hill. Many{machines {and implements}are used on the farm. The plough is a 4 furrow plough which does 10 acres a day and the furrows are 12" wide and 9" deep.Once the land has been ploughed a disc harrow breaks the soil down more and then the rotar spike is used to make it even finer. Then the subtiller turns the soil over so it is ready for seeding. The seeds are sown by a cultivator drill and the crops are harvested by a combine harvester. There was also a fertilizer spinner,a sprayer,a mower and a baler.
